column4: what if my windows drive fails, how will I recover THAT data, it's more important
I'm trying to recreate the grub, and it's refusing to use the /boot/ in my /dev/sdc1 partition
just says unable to mount partition error 17
and it doesn't show the parition type when I try and tab through the different partitions
it says type 0x6 where the ext3 type should be
argh, I need to shoot my desktop
how come? whats the matter with it?
I can mount the partition that I have my boot files in, but grub doesn't see it at all, it see;s an unknown partition type
using all the different tutorials, online don't help either
http://goinggnu.wordpress.com/2007/06/27/restore-grub/ <-- this being the most universal one I've found
the find command doesn't find anything
even if I can find it in the /dev/sdc1 partition myself when I mount it to someplace
what file format is the partition giving you trouble, try unounting it and adding it to fstab or you could recreate the file?
